actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: A bill to amend title 39, United States Code, to provide for the mailing under the congressional franking privilege to Members of Congress of letter mail transmitted by their constituents in response to questionnaires of Members sent to constituents to obtain their opinions on public issues, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Provides for the mailing under the congressional franking privilege to Members of Congress of letter mail transmitted by their constituents in response to questionnaires of Members sent to constituents to obtain their opinions on public issues. (Adds 39 U.S.C. 3220)

titles.title: A bill to amend title 39, United States Code, to provide for the mailing under the congressional franking privilege to Members of Congress of letter mail transmitted by their constituents in response to questionnaires of Members sent to constituents to obtain their opinions on public issues, and for other purposes.
